bill.title: Relating to use of electric assisted bicycles on public trails; declaring an emergency.
bill.description: Directs State Parks and Recreation Department to conduct study to determine feasibility of authorizing use of electric assisted bicycles on public trails that allow for use of nonmotorized bicycles. Directs State Parks and Recreation Department to conduct study to determine feasibility of authorizing use of electric assisted bicycles on public trails that allow for use of nonmotorized bicycles. Requires department to report results of study to appropriate committee or interim committee no later than October 31, 2023. Sunsets January 2, 2024. Declares emergency, effective on passage.

committee.name: Agriculture, Land Use, Natural Resources, and Water

referrals.name: Agriculture, Land Use, Natural Resources, and Water

history.action: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
Referred to Agriculture, Land Use, Natural Resources, and Water.
